overview.purpose: Define the functional and non-functional requirements for a basic To-Do List application.

inScope: Task creation, viewing, updating, and deletion

definitions.definition: A single unit of work tracked by the application.
An authenticated individual who interacts with the application.

functional.title: Create Task
functional.description: The system shall allow the user to create a new task.
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a task title
Task is added to the task list

functional.title: View Tasks
functional.description: The system shall allow the user to view a list of their tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: User can see all tasks they have created

functional.title: Update Task
functional.description: The system shall allow the user to update the title and status of a task.
acceptanceCriteria: User can edit a task's title
User can mark a task as complete or incomplete

functional.title: Delete Task
functional.description: The system shall allow the user to delete a task they own.
acceptanceCriteria: User can remove a task from their list

functional.title: User Authentication
functional.description: The system shall require users to authenticate before accessing any functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users cannot access task data

nonFunctional.description: All user data shall be stored securely using encryption at rest and in transit.
The application shall enforce access controls so users can only access their own tasks.
All authentication attempts and task modifications shall be logged with timestamps and user identifiers.
The application shall be intuitive and require no training.
Task creation, update, and deletion operations shall complete within 2 seconds under normal load.

openQuestions: Should tasks support due dates or reminders?
Is multi-factor authentication required for user login?
What is the expected maximum number of users and tasks?
